title: College style caps
content:
Typeface used on the site for this NY eatery:  
 [http://www.ediandthewolf.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052445/http:/www.ediandthewolf.com/ "http://www.ediandthewolf.com/")

Cheers!

Font: 

 Mexico 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052445/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: John_w

comments.content:
According to code (cufon), the font is called 'Mexico'. Don't know more for the moment.

EDIT: custom job by [Buero New York](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052445/http:/www.buero-newyork.com/work/mexico-typeface).

Couldn't find an exact match. Here are some typefaces with a similar flavor:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/stockbucket/b-52/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052445/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stockbucket/b-52/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/stockbucket/b-52/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052445/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/thunderbolt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052445/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/thunderbolt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/thunderbolt/") [Thunderbolt 75 Bold]

Found it (they even show some work for Edi & The Wolf on this page):  
 [http://www.buero-newyork.com/work/mexico-typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052445/http:/www.buero-newyork.com/work/mexico-typeface "http://www.buero-newyork.com/work/mexico-typeface")
Ryuk named it, I just ran it to ground. Sadly, I don't think it is commercially available....
